file_content.text: This is Watcher Three to Cipher Nine. Things are a little... chaotic without Keeper, so I need a minute to pull our files on Voss.
In the meantime, I did want someone more familiar, but... ah.
Apologies for the wait. Playing catch-up with our friends in the Diplomatic Service, but we think we can brief you.
I didn't realize we had an expert on board.
You know about Voss, Vector?
You said it's "chaotic" there... tell me the truth.
How bad are things at HQ?
The military and the Sith aren't happy with our output, and I can't blame them. Master Hyllus, can you...?
Of course.
Has losing Keeper reduced us to asking advice from friends and family?
We must really be desperate.
The Diplomatic Service has more experience with Voss than anyone. Certainly more than me.
We never served on Voss personally. It's a newly discovered world, home to a simple, humanoid civilization.
One species, one government, one city--Voss-Ka.
Primitive. They didn't even have spaceflight when we made first contact.
But they have art and laws and culture. More importantly, they have citizens who can use the Force--not Jedi or Sith, but something different.
New Force users could change the balance of power.
That must've brought interest.
You're going too fast. Tell me more about the Voss species.
What sort of people are they?
Their whole culture is based on solidarity--loyalty and obedience to family and to the edicts of the Mystics.
Those are the Force sensitives. Healers and fortune-tellers.
What do they have to do with the Star Cabal?
I don't care about the natives.
I'll get to that. Keep going, Vector.
The Voss Force sensitives are called Mystics. They're healers and fortune-tellers, utterly revered and considered infallible.
We want the Voss and the Mystics to ally with the Empire. The Republic is petitioning them, too... yet they remain stubbornly neutral.
Of course, half the galaxy has spies there. Who wouldn't?
Keeper's files clearly indicate conspirator involvement, but no names or details. All I've got are instructions for a meet.
I'll take the bait. What was her plan?
Give me the lead.
Keeper wasn't one to follow hunches.
Why was she so convinced?
I agree. She saw something in these files I don't. I'm sorry.
Do we know anything about this meet?
So I'm going in blind.
There's a teahouse in Voss-Ka proper. You're supposed to wait for a contact--he'll identify himself with the phrase "anew as the spring."
I don't know who he is or whether Keeper told him about the Star Cabal, but he'll know more than I do.
Assuming he's in one piece.
Assuming that. Watcher Three out.
We'll await your instructions.
